IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MONARCH IS COMMITTED TO SUPPORTING, EDUCATING, AND EMPOWERING PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL AND INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES, MENTAL ILLNESS, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE RECOVERY TO CHOOSE AND ACHIEVE WHAT IS IMPORTANT TO THEM. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES RESIDENTIAL, VOCATIONAL, DAY, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND PERIODIC SUPPORTS AND SERVICES TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES WHO HAVE INTELLECTUAL/DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, MENTAL ILLNESS, OR ARE RECOVERING FROM SUBSTANCE ABUSE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL, VOCATIONAL, DAY, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND PERIODIC SUPPORTS AND SERVICES TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES WHO HAVE INTELLECTUAL/DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, MENTAL ILLNESS, OR ARE RECOVERING FROM SUBSTANCE ABUSE.
IRS990.Description: MONARCH RESIDENTIAL SERVICES: MONARCH MANAGES SMALL GROUP HOMES (2-9 PEOPLE), APARTMENT PROGRAMS AND COMPLEXES, ALONG WITH INDEPENDENT LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE INTELLECTUAL/DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES OR MENTAL ILLNESS. GROUP HOME SETTINGS PROVIDE 24 HOUR SUPERVISION. SITES ACCESS QUALIFIED PROFESSIONALS, NURSES, PHYSICIANS, VARIOUS THERAPISTS, DIETICIANS, PSYCHOLOGISTS OR PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES AS NEEDED. APPARTMENT PROGRAMS AND SUPPORTS IN THE COMMUNITY MAY BE 24 HOUR OR PERIODIC. PERSON CENTERED PLANNING FACILITIES USING AN INDIVIDUAL'S DREAMS, VALUES, AND FAMILY CULTURE TO CREATE GOALS FOR GREATER INDEPENDENCE AT HOME AND IN THE COMMUINTY.

Activity2.Description: MONARCH DAY/VOCATIONAL SERVICES: MONARCH PROVIDES A VARIETY OF DAY/VOCATIONAL SERVICES. SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT, MICRO-ENTERPRISE, AND JOB DEVELOPMENT TO HELP PEOPLE BECOME EMPLOYED. VOLUNTEERING AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT WITH SKILLS DEVELOPMENT ASSIST THOSE WHO CHOOSE NOT TO WORK YET, FOR VARIOUS REASONS. WHEN NEEDED, DAY SUPPORTS CAN ALSO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN GAINING HIGHER EDUCATION.

Activity3.Description: MONARCH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES: MONARCH PROVIDES OUTPATIENT THERAPY (INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY, GROUP), MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, PEER SUPPORTS, INTENSIVE IN-HOME, COMMUNITY SUPPORTS,TARGETED CASE MANAGEMENT, DAY TREATMENT, ACTT, DWI SERVICES, AND PSYCHIATRIACTRIC SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH MENTAL ILLNESS AND FOR INDIVIDUALS RECOVERING FROM SUBSTANCE ABUSE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective July 1, 2009, the Organization implemented the new accounting requirements associated with uncertainty in income taxes using the provisions of Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") ASC 740, Income Taxes. Using that guidance, tax positions initially need to be recognized in the financial statements when it is more-likely-than-not the positions will be sustained upon examination by the tax authorities. It also provides guidance for derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure and transition. As of June 30, 2010, the Organization has no uncertain tax positions that qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements.
EFFECT OF MERGER ON FUND BALANCE: 0.
ASSETS RELEASED FROM RESTRICTIONS: 11799. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON 990: 13354.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON 990: 13354.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: DAVE MCGOWAN IS A DIrECTOR AND HER SPOUSE.
PEGGY TERHUNE IS THE CEO AND HIS SPOUSE.
LARRY AND BRENDA HINSON ARE DIRECTORS AND ARE HER PARENTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE ARE SEVERAL MINOR RELATIONSHIPS. PLEASE REFER TO THE DISCLOSURE ON SCHEDULE L FOR DETAILS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CEO AND CFO OF MONARCH FORMERLY ARC SERVICES, INC. IN ADDITION TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE AUDIT FIRM COMPLETING THE FORM WILL MEET AND REVIEW THE 990 WITH THE CEO, CFO, FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD IF REQUESTED. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR OR AUDITOR WILL REVIEW THE 990 WITH THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY, EACH BOARD MEMBER SIGNS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. IN ADDITION, EACH BOARD MEMBER IS CHARGED WITH IDENTIFYING THEIR OWN (OR OTHERS IF NOTICED) CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. YOU CAN SEE OCCASIONAL EVIDENCE OF THIS IN OUR BOARD MINUTES WHEN SOMEONE ABSTAINS FROM A VOTE DUE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board Executive Committee shall act as or appoint a compensation committee that has general oversight of the organization's compensation policies and practices for key employees and executives of Monarch. Specific duties of the compensation committee include: (1) yearly evaluation of the chief executive of the organization including setting of the CEO's compensation, (2) review and approval of the CEO's recommendations for compensating other executives, and (3) review and approval of policies concerning non-cash or other compensation of executives. FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, THERE IS A POLICY IN PLACE FOR SETTING AND REVIEWING COMPENSATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AUDIT AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE AT THE MAIN ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE FOR ANYONE TO REVIEW. THE FINANCIAL 990 IS POSTED ON THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE, AND AN ANNUAL REPORT IS DISTRIBUTED TO STAKEHOLDERS AND PLACED ON THE WEB.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DUTIES LISTED. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE PRIOR YEAR.
